page.title: 04Kimbolton School (Past)
page.content: References to what was known for centuries as the{'Free Grammar School {of Kimbolton'}have been found as far back as 1530.The rent from a small endowment of land and buildings paid "an honest schoolmaster". For most of its history the school buildings stood round the western perimeter of the churchyard, and it fulfilled its purpose of educating the boys within a radius of about 10 miles, although there was a boarding element that housed sons of farmers from a greater distance.A regular number of boys entered Cambridge colleges,particularly St. Johns. From 1876 the school was centred on new buildings at the western end of the village, but the last 40 years have witnessed the most dramatic changes in the school's history.
